Cool, so even when Rodimus sees lightning and hears thunder, he too will th=
ink of Tucson or may very well see him and those elements in a dream.  Afte=
r all, he did get an idea of his stormy like temper before they got separat=
ed .  It would be interesting to have a battle between Magmatron and Tucson=
, as a challenge to preserve the land from further harm.  One on one, in an=
 honorable battle, in warrior mode of course.  And the one who remains on h=
is feet, wins the freedom of the land and it's inhabitants.  He who loses, =
must retreat honorably and give up the opposition he so desperately fights =
for.  It would be an ultimate test of Honor and courage for Tucson, who mus=
t realize that sometimes doing the right thing is to anticipate defeat and =
learn from that in order to avoid it the next time one faces a formidable e=
nemy.  It's a lesson no mentor can teach him, it's a lesson he needs to lea=
rn on his own.  

I think it's a good plot seeing that for a bot, he has a =
lot of backbone and unlike Rodimus, perhaps just a little too much of it.  =
It goes with having his father's temperament and stubbornness.  That too is=
 turning out to be a challenge for him, because Ratchet may have been the c=
hief CMO, but never a Prime.  Tucson, who is very much like Ratchet, is a P=
rime who is having to work with temperament issues as well as the issues im=
pacting everyone else.

When Rodimus started sassing the Preds while on Tuc=
son's back, Tucson was trying desperately to form an alliance and was not i=
n the mood for snide commentary.  His reaction was similar to how Ratchet m=
ight have commented on it.  Good thing Rodimus didn't get the classic " Giv=
e me one good reason why I shouldn't reformat your hard drive and turn you =
into a garbage scow!"
But when Tucson lost his temper Rodimus may have pick=
ed up on his voice pattern which sounds EXACTLY like Ratchet when he lost h=
is temper.  I don't recall Rodimus's relationship with Ratchet but he could=
 probably get an idea that Tucson is from the same mold as the old CMO.

Pe=
rpetually on the move and constantly busy.

> - Preston

>  
> Yes, his roar=
 is the equivalent of what one would feel after the initial boom of a thund=
erhead .  It would be projected as a wave of energy over a certain radius. =
 The lightning symbolizes light which reflects off of Tucson's shimmering s=
ilver armor as it bounces off the draconic scales.  It isn't a weapon it's =
just how the light touches his armor due to the brilliance of his silver pl=
ating.  Call it a visual aesthetic.  I hope this helps.
> 
> 
> Perpetually=
 on the move and constantly busy. 
>

g to have a battle between Magmatron and Tucson, as a challenge to preserve=

arrior mode of course.  And the one who remains on his feet, wins the =
freedom of the land and it's inhabitants.  He who loses, must retreat =
honorably and give up the opposition he so desperately fights for.  It=
 would be an ultimate test of Honor and courage for Tucson, who must realiz=
e that sometimes doing the right thing is to anticipate defeat and learn fr=
om that in order to avoid it the next time one faces a formidable enemy. &n=
bsp;It's a lesson no mentor can teach him, it's a lesson he needs to learn =
on his own.  </div><div><br></div><div>I think it's a good plot seeing=
 that for a bot, he has a lot of backbone and unlike Rodimus, perhaps just =
a little too much of it.  It goes with having his father's temperament=
 and stubbornness.  That too is turning out to be a challenge for him,=
 because Ratchet may have been the chief CMO, but never a Prime.  Tucs=
on, who is very much like Ratchet, is a Prime who is having to work with te=
mperament issues as well as the issues impacting everyone else.</div><div><=

et but he could probably get an idea that Tucson is from the same mold as t=

</p><div>Yes, his roar is the equivalent of what one woul=

<p>I am in agreement with Airly. I could see the ground thing=

ert and<br>you can feel the beat in your chest. But what do you mean by fla=
shes<br>of lightning?<br>
<br>Just making sure I have a clear understanding=
 before I have a clear<br>understanding. Tuscon's sonic roar could be as lo=
ud as thunder and<br>even perhaps sound like it, but would not be thunder i=
n the sense of<br>
being part of the weather patterns.<br><br>For instance =
nearby thunder can range as loud as 120 Db. For<br>references: This is roug=
hly the equivalent to being within 200 feet of<br>a jet aircraft during tak=
e-off or about 3 feet from an auto horn. A<br>
chain saw is rated around 10=
0 decibels. A sound of 140 decibels is<br>painfully loud. [Note each 10 dec=
ibel increase in noise level seems<br>twice as loud.]<br><br>I would imagin=
e that Tuscon is probrably like Brawl in this matter,<br>
but more effectiv=
e in its use, meaning he can hit at almost 300 Db if<br>conscentrated into =
a blast, probrably 200 in a cone and 150 in a wave.<br><br>300 (BEAM) can b=
low out metal and concrete and such like. Basically as<br>
powerful as any =
blast Megatron, Gavatron, Optimus Prime, Rodimus or<br>any other leader typ=
e can deliver. It is just created from Sonic<br>energies rather than more c=
onventional energies.<br><br>200 (CONE) Could concievably kill a human and =
probrably cause serious<br>
